item.title: Craig Anderson gets second straight start in goal for Ottawa Senators
item.description:
OTTAWA - Ottawa Senators head coach Dave Cameron effectively put an end to any brewing goalie controversy Monday.
Cameron announced Craig Anderson will start Tuesday when Ottawa faces Boston in a game that could have playoff implications. The...

item.title: Canada-United States game to open 2016 WJC
item.description:
Canada and the United States will play on the first day of the 2016 IIHF World Junior Championship.
The schedule for the 2016 tournament, which will be held in Helsinki, Finland, will see the two North American teams playing Dec. 26 in a Group...

item.title: Invite to Canada's Olympic camp sparked improvement for Islanders' Hamonic
item.description:
TORONTO - Travis Hamonic would've had to blow Canada's management group away with his play to make the Sochi Olympic team. Still, the New York Islanders defenceman was at orientation camp in August 2014, which meant something.

item.title: Maple Leafs defenceman Polak undergoing hernia surgery, done for season
item.description:
TORONTO - Toronto Maple Leafs defenceman Roman Polak will have season-ending hernia surgery.
Polak, acquired last off-season from the St. Louis Blues, was a key shutdown player for the Leafs and had five goals and four assists in 56 games. ...

item.title: Panthers' Luongo skates, aiming for Thursday return
item.description:
Florida Panthers goaltender Roberto Luongo was on the ice Monday for the first time since he injured his shoulder during a game against the Toronto Maple Leafs on March 3, according to the Miami Herald.

item.title: Maple Leafs' Polak to miss remainder of season
item.description: The Toronto Maple Leafs announced today that defenceman Roman Polak will undergo season-ending hernia surgery. Polak had registered nine points in 56 games with Toronto this season. As a result, the club has recalled defenceman Petter Granberg fro...

item.title: Hudler, Varlamov and Talbot capture NHL's three stars of the week
item.description:
NEW YORK, - Calgary Flames centre Jiri Hudler was named the NHL's first star of the week Monday.
Hudler had four goals and four assists to help Calgary earn seven of a possible eight points. He leads the Flames with 23 goals and 33 assists in...

item.title: Hudler, Varlamov and Talbot named stars of week
item.description:
NEW YORK – Calgary Flames center Jiri Hudler, Colorado Avalanche goaltender Semyon Varlamov and New York Rangers goaltender Cam Talbot have been named the NHL's "Three Stars" for the week ending March 8.

item.title: Leafs' Kadri a healthy scratch versus Islanders after missing team meeting
item.description:
TORONTO - Centre Nazem Kadri will be a healthy scratch Monday night when the Toronto Maple Leafs host the New York Islanders.
The move is punishment for Kadri missing a team meeting Sunday morning.

item.title: Around the League notebook for Sunday, March 8
item.description:
1995 DEVILS TEAM HONORED THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND
The New Jersey Devils celebrated the 20th Anniversary of their 1995 Stanley Cup Championship. More than 20 players and coaches reunited during two days of festivities from March 7-8. The celebrati...

item.title: Brassard scored in overtime, Talbot makes 29 saves in Rangers' 1-0 victory over Blackhawks
item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Varlamov stops 29 shots as Avalanche beat Wild 3-2 for third straight win
item.description:
ST. PAUL, Minn. - Semyon Varlamov stopped 29 shots, Zach Redmond had a goal and an assist, and the Colorado Avalanche beat the Minnesota Wild 3-2 on Sunday night.
Cody McLeod and Gabriel Landeskog also scored for Colorado, which won its third...

item.title: Gibson makes 34 saves as Marlies keep pace in push for playoff spot
item.description:
TORONTO - Christopher Gibson stopped 34 shots — including all 17 that came his way in the third period — as the Toronto Marlies toppled the visiting Utica Comets 3-1 on Sunday in American Hockey League play.

item.title: QMJHL Roundup: Sprong scores two as Islanders edge Titan 4-3 in OT

item.description:

item.title: Lindholm gets first career hat trick, Skinner scores 2 to rally Hurricanes past Oilers 7-4
item.description:

item.title: Penguins prospect Murray sets AHL shutout record
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Maple Leafs send Kadri home, shut down Robidas
item.description:

item.title: Maple Leafs send Nazem Kadri home before practice for missing team meeting
item.description:
TORONTO - Toronto Maple Leafs forward Nazem Kadri missed a team meeting and was sent home before practice, interim coach Peter Horachek said.
Kadri was not on the ice for Sunday's practice, the morning after a 6-1 loss to the St. Louis Blues....

item.description:

item.title: No hard feelings from Leafs or Blues after Phaneuf's hit on Oshie
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Ovechkin scores in return, Glencross gets 3 points and Capitals defeat Sabres, 6-1
item.description:

item.title: 3 early goals, Semyon Varlamov's 44 saves give Avalanche an easy 4-0 win over Blue Jackets

item.title: Killorn and Hedman score early in third period, Lightning rally to beat Stars 5-4
item.description:

item.description:
